title: Principles of Modern Chemistry
author: Raymond Chang
subject: Chemistry
description: A comprehensive textbook covering the foundation of chemical principles, equations, and laboratory practices.
experience: Author with 30+ years in chemical education and research.

title: Organic Chemistry Simplified
author: Paula Yurkanis Bruice
subject: Chemistry
description: Focuses on organic compounds and reactions, written in a student-friendly language with clear illustrations.
award: Top Choice Textbook in Organic Studies
experience: Renowned professor of organic chemistry with global recognition.

title: Fundamentals of Physics
author: David Halliday
subject: Physics
description: An essential introduction to classical and modern physics with problem-solving strategies.

title: Conceptual Physics
author: Paul Hewitt
subject: Physics
description: Simplifies physics concepts for beginners, focusing on real-world examples and clear illustrations.
experience: Over 40 years of teaching conceptual physics worldwide.

title: Human Geography: People, Place, and Culture
author: Erin H. Fouberg
subject: Geography
description: Explores the interaction of people with environments, including population, migration, and globalization.
experience: Author with extensive field research in cultural geography.

title: Physical Geography of the World
author: James Petersen
subject: Geography
description: Covers earth’s landscapes, climates, and ecosystems with modern maps and illustrations.
experience: Professor and researcher in physical geography.

title: English Grammar in Use
author: Raymond Murphy
subject: English Language
description: A self-study reference and practice book for learners of English at intermediate levels.
experience: English educator with 25+ years in language teaching.

title: Literature and Composition
author: Carol Jago
subject: English Language
description: Focuses on improving reading comprehension, literary analysis, and writing skills.
experience: Well-known curriculum developer in English literature.

title: Exploring Social Studies
author: Linda Bennett
subject: Social Studies
description: Introduces students to history, government, and cultures around the world.
experience: Social Studies teacher with over 20 years of classroom practice.

title: World History Atlas
author: Jeremy Black
subject: Social Studies
description: Combines maps and timelines to explain key events in human history.
experience: Renowned historian and world history lecturer.

title: Introduction to Pre-Vocational Studies
author: M. O. Adeyemi
subject: Pre-Vocational Studies
description: Covers agricultural science, home economics, and basic technology for beginners.
experience: Author with practical teaching in vocational studies across Africa.

title: Practical Skills for Young Learners
author: Ngozi Okafor
subject: Pre-Vocational Studies
description: Hands-on guide to learning vocational skills such as sewing, farming, and simple crafts.
experience: Educator with focus on vocational training for schools without computers.
